content.question: An ideal fluid flows through the two sections of cylindrical pipe shown in the figure. The narrow section of the pipe has radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and the wide section has radius <math alttext="2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. What is the ratio of the fluidâ€™s speed in the wide section of pipe to its speed in the narrow section of pipe, <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub wide, and denominator v sub narrow" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>wide</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>narrow</mtext></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
